Sorcerers receive unlimited damage-dealing cantrips.

- Familiars have been completely overhauled.
- Bloodline Spell-Like Ability: The sorcerer's bloodline grants them the ability to cast additional spells as spell-like abilities. These spells may be cast once per day.
- Bloodline Save: The sorcerer's bloodline grants them a bonus to saving throws.
- Font of Power: The sorcerer reduces the cooldowns of all his spells up to 5th level by 25%. In addition, he regains one spell slot for each spell level up to 5th. This ability may be used once every 30 minutes.
- Locus of Power: The sorcerer reduces the cooldowns of all his spells up to 7th level by 25%. In addition, he regains one spell slot for each spell level up to 7th. This ability may be used once every hour.

Bloodlines:
Abyssal:
- Level 4 - Glyph of Hate: The sorcerer marks an enemy with a glyph. All melee and ranged damage dealt by that enemy is stored in this glyph. If a new enemy is marked with the glyph, all stored damage is lost. This ability may be used at will.
- Level 4 - Transfer Hate: The sorcerer may expend all damage within the glyph to deal 50% of the stored damage to an enemy other than the glyphed enemy as negative energy damage. This ability may be used once every 10 minutes.
- Level 9 - Gorge on Hate: The sorcerer may expend all damage within the glyph to heal themselves for an amount of hit points equal to 50% of the damage stored. This ability may be used once every 10 minutes and shares a cooldown with Transfer Hate.
- Level 15 - Malevolence: The sorcerer may expend all damage within the glyph to deal 100% of the stored damage to all creatures within the targeted area in the form of negative energy damage, and 50% of that damage to the sorcerer. Affected creatures, other than the sorcerer, are paralyzed for 2 rounds unless they succeed on a Will saving throw. The DC for this ability is 10 + ½ class level + CHA modifier. This ability may be used once per hour.
- Bloodline Save: +2 vs Fear

Arcane:
- Level 4 - Essence of the Arcane: The sorcerer creates a well of arcane magic at the targeted location. The well fires bolts of pure energy at nearby enemies, as the Magic Missile spell. The caster level for this spell is always 1. This ability may be used once every 8 minutes. Duration is 6 rounds.
- Level 9 - Arcane Dominion: The caster level of the well's Magic Missile spell becomes 3.
- Level 15 - Arcane Perfection: The caster level of the well's Magic Missile spell becomes 5. Additionally, nearby allies win a 3-meter radius of the well are protected, as the Shield spell while it persists.
- Bloodline Save: +1 vs Spells

Draconic:
- Level 4 - Draconic Spirit: The sorcerer blasts forth a wave of energy from their hands, as the Burning Hands spell. This deals 1d6 + ½ class level damage of the damage type associated with the sorcerer's bloodline instead of its regular damage amount and type. This ability may be used once every 3 minutes.
- Level 9 - Majestic Presence: The sorcerer projects an aura of draconic dread. Nearby enemies are frightened for 2 rounds, unless they succeed on a Will saving throw. The DC for this saving throw is 10 + ½ class level + CHA modifier. Animal enemies are not allowed a saving throw against this effect. This ability may be used once every 30 minutes.
- Level 15 - Draconic Insight: The sorcerer gains the effect of the See Invisibility spell, and gains immunity to sleep effects, paralysis, and the element associated with their bloodline. This ability may be used once every hour. Duration is 2 rounds + 1 round / CHA modifier.

Draconic-Bloodline Types:?
Black, Green, Copper: Acid
Blue, Bronze: Electric
Red, Brass, Gold: Fire
White, Silver: Cold

- Bloodline Save: +3 vs Draconic Element

Fey:
- Level 4 - Wild Empathy: This ability functions as the Animal Empathy skill, except that the roll is 1d20 + ½ class level + CHA modifier instead of a skill check.
- Level 9 - Allure of the Nymph: The sorcerer adopts the allure of a nymph. Up to two humanoid creatures in a targeted area are dominated unless they succeed on a Will saving throw. The DC for this saving throw is 10 + ½ Sorcerer level + CHA modifier. This ability may be used once every 30 minutes. Duration is 3 rounds.
- Level 15 - Fey Camouflage: Instantly disappear, as the Invisibility spell. This ability may only be used in natural and outdoor areas, and may be used once every hour.
- Bloodline Save: +2 vs Mind Affecting

Infernal:
- Level 4 - Lingering Flame: The sorcerer immolates a foe with blazing fire, dealing 1d4 + ¼ class level fire damage to them each round unless they succeed on a Reflex saving throw. The DC of this saving throw is 10 + ½ class level + CHA modifier. If an enemy under this effect dies, it jumps to another nearby enemy within a 3-meter radius. This ability may be used once every 5 minutes. Duration is 5 rounds.
- Level 9 - Black Pact: The sorcerer forms a wicked pact with an ally, granting them a +2 bonus to strength and dexterity, and sets their weapon on fire, as the Flame Weapon spell. However, they also suffer 50% vulnerability to cold and a penalty of -4 to savings throws against mind-affecting spells. This ability may be used once every hour. Duration is 10 rounds + ½ class level + CHA modifier.
- Level 15 - Hellfire: The sorcerer calls down a pillar of flame, blasting all enemies within the targeted area for 1d6 + ½ class level fire damage, with a successful Reflex saving throw halving the damage. The DC for this saving throw is 10 + ½ class level + CHA modifier. Affected enemies become frightened for 1 round unless they succeed on a Will saving throw. The DC for this saving throw is 1- + ½ class level + CHA modifier This ability may be used once every 30 minutes.
- Bloodline Save: +2 vs Poison

Wizards conduct their adventures with caution and forethought. When prepared, they can use their spells to devastating effect. When caught by surprise, they are vulnerable. They seek knowledge, power, and the resources to conduct their studies. They may also have any of the noble or ignoble motivations that other adventurers have.

The wizard's strength is their spells. Everything else is secondary. They learn new spells as they experiment and grow in experience, and they can also learn them from other wizards. In addition to learning new spells, a wizard can, over time, learn to manipulate their spells so they go farther, work better, or are improved in some other way. Some wizards prefer to specialize in a certain type of magic. Specialization makes a wizard more powerful in her chosen field, but it denies her access to some of the spells that lie outside that field (see School Specialization below). Like a sorcerer, a wizard can call a familiar - a small, magical animal companion that serves them. For some wizards, their familiars are their only true friends.

WARNING: To cast a spell, a wizard must have an Intelligence score of 10 + the spell's level. For example, to cast a 9th-level spell, a wizard must have an Intelligence of 19.

- Alignment Restriction: None
- Hit Die: d8
- Proficiencies: armor (robes), weapons (wizard)
- Skill Points: 3 + INT Modifier
- Class Skills: All Knowledges, Barter, Bluff, Concentration, Craft Trap, Diplomacy, Heal, Intimidate, Perform, Sense Motive, Spellcraft, Taunt
- Primary Saving Throws: Will
- Base Attack Bonus: +1/2 Levels
- Spellcasting: Arcane (spell failure from armor is a factor), intelligence-based (a base intelligence score of 10 + the spell's level is required to cast a spell, bonus spells are based on modified intelligence, and the intelligence modifier affects spell DCs), and requires preparation. Wizards begin the game knowing all cantrips and four three + intelligence modifier 1st-level spells.

    Wizards receive unlimited Damage Dealing Cantrips.
    Familiars have been completely overhauled.
    Wizard Specialist Variants significantly modified (See Below)
    Arcane Artisan
        The cost of crafting wands and scrolls is reduced by 20%. At level 18, this cost reduction increases to 40%


Wizard Specialist Variants (Spell Schools):
Generalist

Level 1 - Force Blast: Blasts an enemy with a ranged touch attack dealing 1d10 + ½ class level magical damage. This ability may be used once every 3 minutes.
Level 8 - Journeyman’s Recall: The wizard instantly allows his next 1st, 2nd or 3rd level spell cast within 12 seconds to not consume a spell slot. This ability may be used once per day.
Level 15 - Master’s Recall: The wizard instantly allows his next 4th, 5th or 6th level spell cast within 12 seconds to not consume a spell slot. This ability may be used once per day.

Abjuration:

Level 1 - Abjurer’s Aegis: The wizard instantly gains a deflection bonus to armor class equal to 1 + ¼ class level. This ability may be used once every 5 minutes. Duration is 1 round + 1 round / INT modifier.
Level 8 - Allay: The wizard may instantly annuls magical effects on a target, as the Dispel Magic spell. This ability may be used once per day.
Level 15 - Energy Absorption: The wizard shields himself from the elements, as the Energy Buffer spell, but with a cap of 140 hit points. This ability may be used once per day.

Conjuration:

Level 1 - Summoner’s Command: Grants the next creature summoned by the wizard a +1 bonus to its level. This ability may be used once every 30 minutes.
Level 8 - Greater Convocation: Grants the next creature summoned by the wizard a +2 bonus to constitution, a +1 bonus to armor class, a +1 bonus to saving throws, and allows it to regenerate 1 hit point each round. This ability may be used once per hour.
Level 15 - Summoner's Will: Duplicates the next creature summoned by the wizard's Summon Creature spell. This ability may be used once per day. The creatures have a duration of 1 round per class level.

Divination:

    Level 1 - Diviner’s Fortune: The wizard grants a creature a +1 bonus to attack rolls and saving throws. These bonuses increase to +2 at level 12, and to +3 at level 18. Duration is 1 round + 1 round / INT modifier. In addition, the wizard permanently gains a bonus to his Sense Motive skill checks equal to ¼ class level. This ability may be used once every 5 minutes.
    Level 8 - Scry Soul: The wizard may attempt to scry the true identity of another character. Upon succeeding on a Concentration skill check, he learns their true name and whether or not they are disguised. The DC of this skill check is 14 + the scried character's level. Should the wizard fail this check, the scried character is alerted that someone has attempted to scry them but not whom. This ability may be used once per day.
    Level 15 - Secret Eye: The wizard enchants a non-stackable item, which acts as a beacon leading to the creature that possesses it. Secret Eye may only enchant one item at once, and may be dispelled normally. This ability may be used once per day.
    Level 15 - Pierce the Veil: The wizard scries on their item enchanted with Secret Eye, revealing the location of its current possessor. This ability may be used once per hour.

Enchantment:

Level 1 - Daze Bolt: The wizard launches a discombobulating bolt of energy at an enemy. The enemy is dazed for 1 round + 1 round per 8 class levels unless they succeed on a Will saving throw. The DC for this ability is 10 + 1/2 class level + INT modifier. This ability may be used once every 3 minutes.
Level 8 - Alluring Enchantments: Whenever the wizard successfully casts a Charm spell on an enemy, they have a 10% chance of it afflicting all enemies in a 5-meter radius with the same effect.
Level 15 - Dominating Charm: When the wizard successfully casts a Charm spell on an enemy, they become dominated instead. This does not affect enemies charmed by Alluring Enchantments.

Evocation:

Level 1 - Prismatic Barrage: Blats an enemy with elemental missiles, dealing 1d2 magical damage, 1d2 fire damage, 1d2 acid damage, 1d2 cold damage, and 1d2 electric damage. This ability has a 25% chance for its cooldown to be immediately refreshed on use.. This ability may be used once every 3 minutes.
Level 8 - Evoker’s Fury: The wizard's evocation spells have a 10% chance of dealing an additional 1d10 magical damage to enemies in a 5-meter radius around the target.
Level 15 - Trance of Destruction: The wizard's evocation spells, and damage cantrips, have a 3% chance of allowing their next evocation spell of 2nd, 3rd, 4th, 5th, or 6th level to be cast without consuming a spell slot.

Illusion:

Level 1 - Illusory Image: The wizard creates an illusory clone of themselves (including the appearance of effects on the Wizard). The clone mimics the casting of spells known by its creator, drawing the attention of nearby enemies but dealing no damage. It cannot interact with the environment, cannot trigger traps, and has 100% concealment. This ability may be used once per hour. Duration is 1 round + ¼ class level rounds.
Level 8 - PLACEHOLDER: This ability is currently being reworked.
Level 15 - Vision of Awe: The wizard conjures an ethereal spectacle so incredible that it confuses all creatures in a 10-meter radius unless they succeed on a Will saving throw. The DC for this ability is 10 + ½ Wizard level + INT modifier. This ability may be used once per day. Duration is 3 rounds.

Necromancy:

Level 1 - Fetid Ray: The wizard launches a ranged touch attack, dealing 1d6 negative energy damage and inflicting an enemy with the Zombie Creep disease unless they succeed on a Fortitude saving throw. The DC for this saving throw is 15. This ability may be used once every 5 minutes.
Level 8 - Acolyte Necromancer: Grants the next undead creature summoned by the wizard a +2 bonus to strength, and constitution, and allows it to regenerate 2 hit points per round. This ability may be used once per hour.
Level 15 - Deathly Embrace: All undead creatures summoned by the wizard are affected by the Death Armor spell. Duration is 1 round + ¼ class level.

Transmutation:

Level 1 - Abnormal Growth: The wizard distorts a creature's limbs, inflicting it with a -1 penalty to attack rolls and 10% spell failure unless they succeed on a Will saving throw. The DC for this saving throw is 10 + ½ class level + INT modifier. These penalties are increased to -2 and 20% at level 12, and to -3 and 30% at level 18. This ability may be used once every 3 minutes. Duration is 3 rounds.
Level 8 - Enhance Attributes: The wizard grants themselves or an ally a +2 bonus to all ability scores and saving throws. This ability may be used once every 20 minutes. Duration is 1 round + ¼ class level rounds.
Level 15 - Body of Stone: The wizard instantly encases himself in stone. He gains DR 30/+3 and 100% damage immunity to fire, cold, and acid damage. However, he suffers a 25% damage vulnerability to sonic damage and cannot move or perform other actions. This ability may be used once per day. Duration is 3 rounds.

Type of Feat: Class
Prerequisite: Barbarian.
Specifics: The benefits of Rage scale as the Barbarian advances in level:
Rage Modifications:

    Rage no longer reduces your AC while active.
    Rage is now instant cast.
    Fatigue after rage ends now gives a -2 penalty to attack rolls, a -2 penalty to armor class, and reduces attacks per round by 1 for 5 rounds.

The benefits of Rage scale with level:

    Level 2 - Barbarian Rage: The barbarian is granted a +2 bonus to strength, a +2 bonus to dexterity, a +1 bonus to Will saving throws, and 5 temporary hit points. This ability may be used every 6 minutes.
    Level 8 - Violent Rage: The barbarian is granted a +4 bonus to strength, a +2 bonus to dexterity, a +2 bonus to Will saving throws, and 5 temporary hit points. This ability may be used every 6 minutes.
    Level 12 - Indomitable Rage: The barbarian is granted a +4 bonus to strength, a +4 bonus to dexterity, a +2 bonus to Will saving throws, and 10 temporary hit points. This ability may be used every 5 minutes.
    Level 16 - Brutal Rage: The barbarian is granted a +4 bonus to strength, a +4 bonus to dexterity, a +3 bonus to Will saving throws, 10 temporary hit points and an additional attack per round. This ability may be used every 5 minutes.


Use: Activated / Cooldown.

Type of Feat: Class
Prerequisite: Assassin level 9.
Specifics: Starting at 7th level, an Assassin gains the ability to use Improved Dust of Tracelessness. Having the same effect as improved invisibility of the same level.
Use: Selected

Type of Feat: Class
Prerequisite: Assassin level 1.
Specifics: Starting at 1st level, an Assassin adds +1 to the DC of any poisons they apply to their weapons.

Type of Feat: Class
Prerequisite: Assassin level 2.
Specifics: Starting at 2nd level, an Assassin gains the ability to deploy a smokescreen. Having the same effect as entropic shield of the same level.
Use: Selected

Type of Feat: Class
Prerequisite: Arcane Archer level 3.
Specifics: At 3rd level, an Arcane Archer gains the ability to launch an arrow once per day that has the effects of the Entagle spell. This ability can be used twice per day starting at level 6.
Use: Selected.

Type of Feat: Class
Prerequisite: Arcane Archer level 4.
Specifics: At 4th level, an Arcane Archer gains the ability to launch an arrow once per day that has the effects of the Blindness/Deafness spell. This ability can be used twice per day starting at level 7.
Use: Selected.

Type of Feat: Class
Prerequisite: Arcane Archer level 6.
Specifics: At 6th level, an Arcane Archer gains the ability to launch an arrow once per day that has the effects of the Hold Monster. This ability can be used twice per day starting at level 8.
Use: Selected.

Type of Feat: Class
Prerequisite: Arcane Archer level 7.
Specifics: At 7th level, an Arcane Archer gains the ability to launch an arrow once per day that has the effects of the slow spell. This ability can be used twice per day starting at level 9.
Use: Selected.

Type of Feat: Class
Prerequisite: Arcane Archer level 8.
Specifics: At 8th level, an Arcane Archer gains the ability to launch an arrow once per day that has the effects of the silence spell.
Use: Selected.

Type of Feat: Class
Prerequisite: Arcane Archer level 9.
Specifics: At 9th level, an Arcane Archer gains the ability to launch an arrow once per day that has the effects of the greater dispell spell.
Use: Selected.

Type of Feat: Class
Prerequisite: Arcane Archer level 8.
Specifics: In lieu of a regular attack, once per day an 8th level Arcane Archer can fire an arrow at each and every target within range, to a maximum of one target for every Arcane Archer level they have. This can be used a second time per day at 10th level.
Use: Selected.

Type of Feat: Class
Prerequisite: Shadowdancer level 1.
Specifics: Starting at 1st level, a shadowdancer gains the ability to cast Darkness once per day. They gain an second use per day at 4th level, a 3rd at 7th and a fourth at 9th.
Use: Selected.

Type of Feat: Class
Prerequisite: Shadowdancer level 2.
Specifics: Starting at 2nd level, a shadowdancer gains the ability to cast Shadow Conjuration once per day.
Use: Selected.

Type of Feat: Class
Prerequisite: Shadowdancer level 7.
Specifics: Starting at 7th level, a shadowdancer gains the ability to cast Greater Shadow Conjuration once per day.
Use: Selected.

Type of Feat: Class
Prerequisite: Shadowdancer level 10.
Specifics: Starting at 10th level, a shadowdancer gains the ability to cast Shades once per day.
Use: Selected.

Air Domain
Clerics of the Air domain command power over creatures of the Elemental Planes and gain the ability to cast electrical damage spells.

Domain Special Abilities and Bonus Spells: 
-Zephyr: Creates swirling air around the cleric granting anyone inside the radius a 50% concealment against ranged attacks. Duration is 5 rounds + CHA modifier rounds.
-The cleric gains access to the following spells at the specified spell level: Horizikauls Boom(1), Call Lightning (3), Call Lightning Storm (5), Great Thunderclap (7).

Animal Domain
Clerics who take the Animal domain are able summon more powerful allies.

Domain Special Ability and Bonus Spells:
-Stronger Summons: Grants the next creature summoned by the cleric a +1 bonus to strength and dexterity per 3 caster levels.
-The cleric gains access to the following spells at the specified spell level: Magic Fang (1), Dominate Animal (3), Hold Monster (5), Aura of Vitality (7).

Death Domain
Clerics who take the Death domain can summon an enhanced shadow and gains spells related to death and dying.

Domain Special Ability and Bonus Spells:
-Death Touch: Make a melee touch attack against a living creature. On a successful hit, this ability deals 1d6 points of negative energy damage per class level.
-The cleric gains access to the following spells at the specified spell level: Negative Energy Ray (1), Negative Energy Burst (3), Enervation (5), Horrid Wilting (8).

Destruction Domain
Clerics who take the Destruction domain are able to damage constructs through force of will and are granted spells that allow them to weaken and destroy their enemies.

Domain Special Ability and Bonus Spells:
-Empowered Inflict: The cleric's Inflict spells are automatically cast as if they were affected by the Empower Spell metamagic feat.
-The cleric gains access to the following spells at the specified spell level: Inflict Moderate Wounds (1), Inflict Critical Wounds (3), Harm (5), Incendiary Cloud (8).

Earth Domain
Clerics of the Earth domain command power over creatures of the Elemental Planes and are granted spells that protect against melee and energy damage.

Domain Special Ability and Bonus Spells:
-Anchor: Grants a creature immunity to knockdown and forced movement, but reduces their movement speed by 99%.. Duration is 5 rounds + CHA modifier rounds.
-The cleric gains access to the following spells at the specified spell level: Grease (1), Mestil's Acid Breath (3), Mestil's Acid Sheathe (5), Earthquake (7).

Evil Domain
Clerics who take the Evil domain command power over outsiders and are granted spells that manipulate negative energy.

Domain Special Ability and Bonus Spells:
-Word of Truth: As the Fear spell, except that it only affects Lawful and/or Good creatures. This ability bypasses immunity to fear and mind-affecting effects but may be saved against normally. Duration is 1d3 + 1 rounds.
-The cleric gains access to the following spells at the specified spell level: Protection from Alignment (1), Magic Circle vs Alignment (3), Cloudkill (5), Aura Versus Alignment (7).

Fire Domain
Clerics who take the Fire domain command power over creatures of the Elemental Planes and are granted spells that summon and protect against fire.

Domain Special Ability and Bonus Spells:
-Fan The Flames: As the Burning Hands spell, except that it does not have a cap to its number of damage dice.
-The cleric gains access to the following spells at the specified spell level: Burning Hands (1), Flame Arrow (3), Firebrand (5), Firestorm (7).

Good Domain
Clerics who take the Good domain command power over outsiders and are granted spells that protect themselves and others.

Domain Special Ability and Bonus Spells:
-Word of Truth: As the Fear spell, except that it only affects Chaotic and/or Evil creatures. This ability bypasses immunity to fear and mind-affecting effects but may be saved against normally. Duration is 1d3 + 1 rounds.
-The cleric gains access to the following spells at the specified spell level: Protection from Alignment (1), Magic Circle vs Alignment (3), Blade Barrier (5), Aura Versus Alignment (7).

Plant Domain
Clerics who take the Plant domain are able to repel and destroy vermin and have spells that call upon the power of nature to protect and destroy.

Domain Special Ability and Bonus Spells:
-Nature's Blessing: As Lesser Restoration, but only removes magical effects as well as healing the target for 1 hit point per class level. Additionally, your Conjure Creature spells now summon animals as if they were Call Nature's Ally spells of the same level.
-The cleric gains access to the following spells at the specified spell level: Entangle (1), Spike Growth (3), Vine Mine (5), Creeping Doom (7).

Protection Domain
Clerics who take the Protection domain are able to shield themselves from harm using their special abilities and spells.

Domain Special Ability and Bonus Spells:
-Divine Protection ability.
-The cleric gains access to the following spells at the specified spell level: Resist Elements (1), Death Ward (3), Energy Buffer (5), Protection From Spells (7).
Use: Once/Day.

Sun Domain
Clerics who take the Sun domain are better able to turn undead than their brethren, and gain spells that are harmful to undead.

Domain Special Ability and Bonus Spells:
-Exceptional Turning: Add 1d6 to all turning checks to determine the maximum HD of undead turned.
-The cleric gains access to the following spells at the specified spell level: Ultravision (1), Combust (3), Undead To Death (5), Sunbeam (7).

Travel Domain
Clerics who take the Travel domain gain access to an improved list of bonus spells.

Domain Special Ability and Bonus Spells:
-Longstrider: Increases the caster's movement speed by 10%. Duration is 10 minutes + 1 minute per class level.
-The cleric gains access to the following spells at the specified spell level: Expeditious Retreat (1), Freedom of Movement (3), Dimension Door (5), Mass Haste (7).

War Domain
Clerics who take the War domain can summon the power of their deity to become engines of destruction. They also gain access to spells that improve their battle prowess.

Domain Special Ability and Bonus Spells:
-Battle Mastery Feat: The cleric gains a bonus of 1 + 1 per 6 cleric levels to strength, dexterity and constitution.
-The cleric gains access to the following spells at the specified spell level: Blood Frenzy (1), Keen Edge (3), Blade Barrier (5), Aura of Vitality (7).
Use: Once/Day.

Water Domain
Clerics who take the Water domain command power over creatures of the Elemental Planes and are granted spells that weaken or kill opponents.

Domain Special Ability and Bonus Spells:
-Drench: Grants all creatures in an area 50% resistance to fire, as well as inflicting them with 50% weakness to cold unless they succeed on a Reflex saving throw. Duration is 5 rounds + CHA modifier rounds.
-The cleric gains access to the following spells at the specified spell level: Ice Dagger (1), Poison (3), Ice Storm (5), Drown (7).
Use: Once/Day.

Type of Feat: Class
Specifics: The fighter may charge recklessly into combat. He increases his movement speed by 50%, and granting him a +2 bonus to attack rolls as well as inflicting him with a -2 penalty to armor class. Duration is 1 round. This ability may be used once every 3 minutes.
Use: Instant

Type of Feat: Class
Specifics: The fighter may command his allies, rallying them to his side and warning them of coming threats. Nearby allies gain a +1 dodge bonus to armor class and a +1 bonus to all saving throws for 3 rounds + 1 round per 2 class levels. This ability may be used once every 30 minutes. The cooldown is reduced to 20 minutes at level 17.
Use: Instant

Type of Feat: Class
Specifics: The fighter can gather his strength for a second wind. This effect instantly heals him for 1d10 + class level hit points. This ability may be used once every 20 minutes.
Use: Activated.

Type of Feat: General
Prerequisite: Dexterity 13.
Required For: Improved Two-Weapon Fighting.
Special: Also grants the Ambidexterity feat for free.
Specifics: A character with this feat reduces the penalties suffered when fighting with two weapons. The normal penalty of -6 to the primary hand and -10 to the off-hand becomes -4 for the primary hand and -8 for the off-hand. The Ambidexterity feat further reduces the attack penalty for the second weapon by 4 (to -4/-4). Best results are achieved if the off-hand weapon is light, further reducing the penalty for both the primary and off-hand by 2 (to -2/-2). Rangers receive this feat for free at level 1.
Use: This feat is used automatically during combat.

Type of Feat: General
Prerequisite: Two-Weapon Fighting, 15 Dexterity and base attack bonus +9 or higher.
Specifics: The character with this feat is able to get a second off-hand attack (at a penalty of -5 to his attack roll).
Use: Automatic. Rangers receive this feat at level 9, even if they don't meet the requirements.

Type of Feat: General
Prerequisite: Int 13+, Expertise, and a base attack bonus of +6.
Specifics: A character with this feat can make defensive attacks, gaining a +10 bonus to AC but receiving a -10 penalty to attack rolls.
Use: Combat Mode.

Type of Feat: Class
Prerequisite: Paladin level 2
Specifics: This ability allows Paladins to apply their Charisma modifier to their attack roll, and half their class level to the damage against attacks against evil creatures for 4 rounds. Smite Evil may be used once per day at level 2 with an additional use at every 4th paladin level for a total of 6 uses per day at level 18.

Use: Selected.

(PRESTIGE CLASS) 
Bladesingers are elves who bravely defend their people and lands. They are elf wizards who master a school of sword fighting grounded in a tradition of arcane magic. In combat, a bladesinger uses a series of intricate, elegant maneuvers that fend off harm and allow the bladesinger to channel magic into devastating attacks and a cunning defense. Only elves and half-elves can choose the bladesinger arcane tradition. In the world of Faerûn, elves closely guard the secrets of bladesinging.

- Alignment Restriction: None
- Hit Die: d8
- Proficiencies: Light Armor
- Skill Points: 3 + INT Modifier
- Class Skills: All Knowledge, Barter, Bluff, Concentration, Craft Trap, Diplomacy, Heal, Intimidate, Perform, Sense Motive, Spellcraft, Taunt, Tumble
- Primary Saving Throws: Reflex & Will
- Base Attack Bonus: + 1 Levels

--- Requirements ---

- Racial Restriction: Elf & (Half-Elf with Elven Bladesinger Mentorship)
- Base Attack Bonus: +6
- Feats: Combat Casting, Weapon Focus (Longsword or Rapier)
- Skills: Concentration 6 Ranks, Perform 4 Ranks, Tumble 5 Ranks
- Spellcasting: Ability to cast arcane spells 1st level or higher

Level:
2: Bladesong Style, Lesser Spellsong
3: Song of Fury
4: Greater Spellsong
5: Song of Celerity

Spells per Day: The bladesinger gains new spells per day as if they had also gained a level in an arcane spellcasting class they have already advanced in at level 1 and level 4.. They do not learn new spells at these levels.

Bladesong Style: While wielding a longsword or rapier in their main hand and nothing in their off-hand, the bladesinger's receives a shield bonus to AC and a bonus to damage equal to their INT modifier to a maximum of ½ their class level. (rounded down). Additionally, the bladesinger gains 20% spell failure reduction while wearing light armor and a +3 bonus to Concentration skill checks. This ability may not be used while wearing medium or heavy armor, or while using a shield.

Lesser Spellsong: The bladesinger becomes capable of a dance of death; their body swaying and writhing to the rhythm of combat and the sound of blades striking flesh. This whirl of steel can be mesmerizing and overwhelming to all who oppose them. This grants the bladesinger 10% concealment, makes them impossible to tie down as the Freedom of Movement spell, and grants them immunity to mind-affecting spells. This ability may be used once every 20 minutes. Duration is a number of rounds equal to their Perform skill ranks.

Song of Fury: The bladesinger can shape the Weave with their blade, summoning echoes from aeons past, gaining a +4 bonus to strength and dexterity , and dealing an additional 1d2 Sonic damage with their melee attacks. These bonuses are also applied to all nearby elves. Nearby half-elves gain 50% of these bonuses. This ability may be used once every 8 minutes. Duration is 3 rounds + 1 round / INT modifier.

Greater Spellsong: The bladesinger's spellsong further sharpens their mind, enveloping them in a state of meditative focus and grace. This grants the bladesinger 20% concealment, makes them impossible to pin down as the Freedom of Movement spell, grants them immunity to mind-affecting spells, and a +4 bonus to intelligence. This ability upgrades and replaces Lesser Spellsong and may be used once every 12 minutes. Duration is a number of rounds equal to their Perform skill ranks.

Song of Celerity: The bladesinger may invoke the ancestral power of the elves, as the Haste and Wounding Whispers spells. These bonuses are also applied to nearby elves. Nearby half-elves gain 50% of these bonuses. This ability may be used once every 12 minutes. Duration is 3 rounds.

*****************-The Dragon's Neck-*******************
***************-Custom Class Changes-*****************
***************************************************************

(PRESTIGE CLASS)
It is rumored that the magical powers of sorcerers and bards is somehow connected to the presence of dragon blood in their family tree. Dragon Disciples are sorcerers, and sometimes bards, who use their magical power as a catalyst to ignite their dragon blood, realizing its fullest potential. They prefer a life of exploration to a cloistered existence. Already adept at magic, many pursue adventure, especially if it furthers their goal of finding out more about their draconic heritage. They often feel drawn to areas known to harbor dragons.

- Hit Die: Special (see below)
- Proficiencies: A Dragon Disciple does not gain any additional weapon or armor proficiencies.
- Skill Points: 3+ Int Modifier.
- Base Attack Bonus: Full

REQUIREMENTS:

Class: Able to cast level 5 Bard or Sorcerer spells
Skills: 8 Ranks in Knowledge: Arcane

ABILITIES:

Note: This class has been condensed down into 5 levels, and can choose the dragon type

Level
1: Draconic Armor - The character's skin develops nearly invisible scales that increase his/her natural armor class by +1. 
  Hit Dice Increase (d6) - The character rolls d6 for hit points. This change is not retroactive.
2: Draconic Ability Scores -  Strength +2.
3: Breath Weapon I - The character can breathe a cone of fire, dealing 2d10 points of damage to each opponent caught in the flames.
  Draconic Ability Scores -  Strength +2.
4: Hit Dice Increase (d8) - The character rolls d8 for hit points. This change is not retroactive.
  Draconic Ability Scores -  Constitution  +2, Intelligence +2.
  Breath Weapon II - The character's breath weapon damage potential increases to 4d10 points of damage.
5: Draconic Armor  - The character's skin becomes even harder, raising his/her natural armor class to +2.
  Hit Dice Increase (d10)  - The character rolls d10 for hit points.  This change is not retroactive.  
  Darkvision - The character gains a dragon's ability to see in the dark.
  Immunity to sleep, paralysis, fire.
  Draconic Ability Scores - Strength +4, Charisma +2.
  Breath Weapon III - The character does 6d10 points of damage with his breath weapon.

Type of feat: class
Prerequisite: ranger 1

Specifics:

At level 3, the Ranger gets to choose a Wild Path, selecting either Wild Strike or Wild Shot. At level 8, 13 and 18 these abilities improve.
Wild Strike:
Level 3: You enchant your melee weapon(s) for 4 rounds + your Wisdom modifier. Your weapon is treated as having a +1 Enchantment vs your Favoured Enemies. Additionally, your melee weapon gains the Wounding Effect [DC 14] vs all enemies. This ability can be used once every 4 minutes.
Level 8: You enchant your melee weapon(s) for 4 rounds + your Wisdom modifier. Your weapon is treated as having a +2 Enchantment vs your Favoured Enemies. Additionally, your melee weapon gains the Wounding Effect [DC 16] vs all enemies. This ability can be used once every 4 minutes.
Level 13: You enchant your melee weapon(s) for 4 rounds + your Wisdom modifier. Your weapon is treated as having a +2 Enchantment vs your Favoured Enemies. Additionally, your melee weapon gains the Wounding Effect [DC 18] and Vampiric Regen 1 vs all enemies. This ability can be used once every 4 minutes.
Level 18: You enchant your melee weapon(s) for 4 rounds + your Wisdom modifier. Your weapon is treated as having a +3 Enchantment vs your Favoured Enemies. Additionally, your melee weapon gains the Wounding Effect [DC 20] and Vampiric Regen 2 vs all enemies. This ability can be used once every 4 minutes.


Use: Activated.

Type of feat: class
Prerequisite: ranger 1

Specifics:

At level 3, the Ranger gets to choose a Wild Path, selecting either Wild Strike or Wild Shot. At level 8, 13 and 18 these abilities improve.

Wild Shot:
Level 3: You enchant your ranged weapon for 4 rounds + your Wisdom modifier. Your weapon is treated as having a +1 AB, +1 Divine damage bonus vs your Favored Enemies. Additionally, your ranged weapon gains +1d4 Massive Critical vs all enemies. This ability can be used once every 4 minutes.
Level 8: You enchant your ranged weapon for 4 rounds + your Wisdom modifier. Your weapon is treated as having a +2 AB, +2 Divine damage bonus vs your Favored Enemies. Additionally, your ranged weapon gains +1d4 Massive Critical vs all enemies. This ability can be used once every 4 minutes.
Level 13: You enchant your ranged weapon for 4 rounds + your Wisdom modifier. Your weapon is treated as having a +2 AB, +2 Divine damage bonus vs your Favored Enemies. Additionally, your ranged weapon gains +1d6 Massive Critical and Keen vs all enemies. This ability can be used once every 4 minutes.
Level 18: You enchant your ranged weapon for 4 rounds + your Wisdom modifier. Your weapon is treated as having a +3 AB, +3 Divine damage bonus vs your Favored Enemies. Additionally, your ranged weapon gains +1d6 Massive Critical and Keen vs all enemies. This ability can be used once every 4 minutes.

Use: automatic
The bear is an impressive animal. It's large size and great strength make it a dangerous opponent in melee.
The boar is usually agressive, capable of doing a lot of damage with it's tusks. Though not carnivorous, it will attack anyone who comes too close.
A large and powerful wild cat, the Cougar makes its home in mountainous regions. It's often identified by its tawny, unmarked coat.
Hawks are birds of prey with sharp beaks and keen senses, known to spot prey from high up and making sudden dashes from concealed perches.
Leopards are large, territorial spotted cats. They are very successful hunters, moving silently trough the vegetation to attack their prey at close quarters.
Known as the King of the Great Cats, the Lion is large, fierce, and regal. A confident hunter, it attacks swiftly and with crushing force.
Black as a Chultan night and just as deadly, these sleek cats attack from the shadows, disappearing back into them once the hunt is through.
These omnivorous rodents thrive almost anywhere. Most people consider them a bad omen.
Skunks are not usually agressive, or overly dangerous. Their main weapon is the ability to excrete a foul-smelling odour.
Snakes are not typically aggressive and flee when confronted. Venemous snakes, though, may bite instinctively before fleeing. Some snakes grow to enormous sizes, making them dangerous opponents.
Often mistaken as being insects, spider are feared because of their venom and their ability to thow webs at opponents, basically holding them in place.
Huge, powerful and silent the tiger is a feared hunter in its native areas.
An icon of rugged individualism, yet renowned for its ability to hunt in packs, the noble Wolf is an animal of both mystique and power.
Largest of the land-dwelling weasel types, wolverines are stronger than their size would suggest, and extremely bold, sometimes going head-to-head with much larger predators for food.
These winged, nocturnal rodents are rarely considered threatening in their own right, though traditional folklore does associate them with vampirism and the undead.
House and alley cats are common in populated areas, prized for their abilities to keep the rodent populations in check; that is, when they aren't being persecuted as witch's familiars.

A chaotic offshoot of the pseudodragon, the faerie dragon lives in peaceful, tangled forests and thrives on pranks, mischief and practical jokes.  Faerie dragons resemble miniature dragons with gossamer butterfly wings.  Although they are generally well-meaning, most adventurers are advised to be wary of their sense of humor.
Chaotic and destructive, Mephits come in many shapes and have a wide range of abilities. Most are drawn from the various Elemental and Quasi-Elemental Planes.
Small but insidious devils often bound to the service of sorcerers and wizards, Imps have a gleeful attraction to pranks, riddles, and bawdy jokes.
Usually nocturnal or crepuscular birds of prey, owls are usually associated with wisdom and knowledge.
Talented illusionists and irreverent pranksters, Pixies make their homes in hollowed trees and rocky grottoes, deep within the forests. Their nimble fingers also make them adept at lock picking.

Pseudodragons resemble miniature red dragons, but are red-brown in color rather than deep red.  They have fine scales and sharp horns and teeth.  Their barbed, venomous tails are their favored weapons.
With their cold eyes and glossy black feathers, these airborne scavengers are often considered ill omens or harbingers of death.

Type of Feat: Item Creation
Prerequisite: Spellcaster Level 1st+.
Specifics: You can create a scroll of any spell that you know. The scribing system has been overhauled with the following changes on TDN:

- Experience cost has been removed.
- Currency cost is: 15 + (Innate Spell Level × 15) taran (sp).
- A crafting point system has been added - you have a pool of crafting points equal to your highest caster level (wizards receive a +3 bonus, maximum 14). This pool refills every 24 hours.
- Scribing a scroll costs crafting points equal to the innate spell level (cantrips cost 1 point).
- Scrolls are created with the minimum caster level required to cast the spell.
- Created scrolls can be traded or sold to players, but not to NPCs.
- Scrolls expire after one week.

Cost Examples:
- Cantrip scroll: 1 crafting point, 30 sp
- 1st-level scroll (like bless): 1 crafting point, 30 sp  
- 3rd-level scroll (like fireball): 3 crafting points, 60 sp
- 6th-level scroll (like chain lightning): 6 crafting points, 105 sp

Use: Selected (In order to scribe a scroll, the character has to cast the spell in question on a specially prepared blank scroll)

Type of Feat: Item Creation
Prerequisite: Spellcaster Level 1st+.
Specifics: You can create a wand of any spell of 4th level or lower that you know. The wand crafting system has been overhauled with the following changes on TDN:

- Experience cost has been removed.
- Currency cost is: 50 + (Innate Spell Level × 25) taran (sp).
- A crafting point system has been added - you have a pool of crafting points equal to your highest caster level (wizards receive a +3 bonus, maximum 14). This pool refills every 24 hours.
- Crafting a wand costs crafting points equal to twice the innate spell level (cantrips cost 2 points).
- Wands are created with 20 charges total, with a maximum of 5 uses per day/per rest.
- Wands are created with the minimum caster level required to cast the spell.
- Created wands can be traded or sold to players, but not to NPCs.
- Wands expire after one week.

Cost Examples:
- Cantrip wand: 2 crafting points, 75 sp
- 1st-level wand (like magic missile): 2 crafting points, 75 sp
- 2nd-level wand (like acid arrow): 4 crafting points, 100 sp
- 3rd-level wand (like fireball): 6 crafting points, 125 sp
- 4th-level wand: 8 crafting points, 150 sp

Use: Selected (In order to craft a wand, the character has to cast the spell in question on a specially crafted wand)

PvP should support a story. PvP without preceding RP that reflects hostility is unacceptable. Consider alternate resolutions before mechanical PvP. Anyone you plan to fight must be toggled hostile (!pvp).
Do not let OOC motivations fuel an IC conflict or PvP. If you feel you've been targeted by OOC motivations, contact a DM or Admin.
Erotic Roleplay (ERP) and excessive sexual innuendo are prohibited.

Maintain the server's setting and your character's integrity. Stay true to what your character would do, but not at the cost of another player's experience - have OOC consideration and contact a DM if you want advice.
Remember to stay IC at all times unless OOC is absolutely necessary. Longer OOC conversations can be taken to private Tells, which are always considered OOC.
Be considerate of how NPCs would react to your character and their actions - even without a DM present. Brandishing your weapon in a full tavern may not be wise unless with good reason!

All characters can only have a maximum of one Prestige Class. There are no multiclass XP penalties. Paladin and Monk multiclassing is limited by their order. Several classes require 12 levels invested.
Characters may have two single digits (below 10) in ability scores - more than that is an illegal build.

Follow the guidelines regarding choosing patron deities found in the wiki page "Pantheons and Patrons". Through a DM, a character may later shift outside these restrictions with evidenced IC progress.
Do not use exploits, i.e. sidestepping to avoid encumbrance, or taking advantage of a bug in a custom system - both are bannable offenses. Report bugs you become aware of (!br <bug description>).
You must have at least 2 levels of Monk/Paladin for every 1 level of another multiclass taken with them. Multiclass options are decided by their order.
The city of Murann hosts a strong following of Selûne, the roots of their enduring faith going back centuries. It is said the majority of the city worships the Moonmaiden as their patron deity.
The premier deity in Amn, Waukeen is deeply revered nearly everywhere in the nation. Temple services are often parties and banquets, or trade-related ceremonies.
It is widely believed in Amn and most of the Realms that speaking a god's name draws their attention, for good or ill. It is because of this that most take to usage of titles instead.
Due to the importance of agriculture in Amn, Chauntea is worshipped widely near the time of harvests. Most worship occurs in small shrines in rural areas.
The Conclave is a budding gathering of several druidic creeds native to the region, focused on combatting the impact of The Longest Year on nature.
Jewellery in Amn is one of many shows of status. Gem-inlaid precious metal rings are common, and pearls (especially black pearls) are highly coveted.

Vests or cloaks of fur from the North are fashionable in Amn, despite the temperate climate. The popularity is attributed to the difficulty of obtaining goods from the North, and the inherently exotic nature for the average Amnian.

Women in Amn often wear headdresses, with more elaborate and ornate examples showing off higher status, such as gold, silver or platinum threaded embroidery. Metal-embroidered silk garments are popular amongst all classes and both genders.
The Winter of Teeth begins in 1368 DR, a monstrous horde marching on north-western Amn and dividing the nation when Imnescar and Athkatla are conquered. The war is still ongoing.

The Longest Year, the absence of magic following the Time of Troubles, had a profound effect on the entirety of the Realms. Magic is chaotic and unpredictable, resulting in superstition and fear dominating the perception and beliefs of the common folk.
Amn, the Merchant's Domain, has been governed by the Council of Six since 1333 DR. This mysterious, anonymous group is rumoured to consist of the most influential merchant houses of the nation.

In 1359 DR, following The Longest Year, Cyricists took advantage of the chaos to grow the war on knowledge. Over the next four years, libraries and historical texts were destroyed across Amn, in what became known as the Years of Bonfires.
The Swordbelt, according to rural Amnians in particular, is rumoured to suffer from consistent but often faint tremors. Equally many Muranni claim such talk to be simply fanciful old wives' tales.

Magic in Amn is viewed with suspicion or fear at best, and is persecuted at worst. Amnian folk-lore and aphorisms have always had a distinctly anti-magic bent, and The Longest Year has only worsened matters.

The weeping willow is a common sign of mourning in Amn. Its folk-lore often pokes tendrils into death superstitions and sayings. It is believed that when a willow grew large enough to cast a grave-sized shadow, a family member would die.

The forest of Wylvyr - meaning Willowood in an old Amnian dialect - is avoided by most natives, believed to be inhabited by a malevolent fey creature of varying descriptions. Moreover, locals are wary of willow, ascribing many a superstition to its appearance and existence alike.
The Ommlur and Umar Hills, forming the foothills of The Small Teeth mountain range, are infamous for old legends and enduring dangers - only the foolhardy and suicidal are said to frequent them.

Mt. Speartop is the tallest mountain in the Cloud Peaks, and can be seen on clear days from most of Amn. It is part of daily life in many settlements, clear day or no; "I swear on Speartop" is a common oath among the lower classes of not only North Amn, but all of Amn.

Feared and hated even to this day, Arbas “the Black Usurper” Torlath's name is commonly used throughout Amn as a curse. Stories of him vary, enough to make the roots of such hatred difficult to track down.
The erstwhile village of Bormton - ruined and supposedly haunted - is commonly used by rural Amnians as a cautionary tale against meddling in the affairs of outsiders.

The fall of Athkatla is a fresh wound for many Amnians, the former capital having once been perceived as not only the jewel of Amn, but also as an indestructible bastion of humanity. Countless people fear a similar fate for the rest of Amn.

The Spring of 1368 DR came into Amnian history as the Season of Rutted Roads and Heavy Ships as chaos erupted throughout the former capital of Athkatla. Over a hundred thousand refugees fled Athkatla north or east in anticipation of the Winter Horde.

The Pirate's Pardon, Queen Zaranda's first edict on her new throne, was a pardon to all non-monstrous pirates with the condition they accepted a letter of marque from Tethyr and lended their ships and crews to the defense of the coast.

The Iron Fleet, a united monstrous armada, poses a great danger to the seaward routes and the trade that comes with them. Even most islands in the vicinity of the Sword Coast are believed to be at risk of being overtaken by Black Balura.

The Wealdath, a bastion of elvenkind, has seen precious little human interference since The Longest Year. Yet with the return of magic and continued war in Amn, logging operations and human expansion have once more become a threat to the People.

Humans of both Tethyr and Amn have a long history of conflict with the elves of the Wealdath. Though Amn is embroiled in war and Tethyr is recovering from the Interregnum, old hatreds still persist among both peoples - despite attempts to the contrary.

The Tethir Road, strewn with yellow flags, is a long road stretching from Murann in the west to the city of Riatavin in the east, north of the Wealdath. Though much of it has fallen to disrepair and neglect, the road remains a major trade route.

Wealth and attire are the main indicators of status in Amn. A successful person is often measured by the amount of wealth they display in material possessions, whether objects on the person or owned land.

Dressing in ornate or fancy garments and jewellery is supposedly frowned upon amongst the wealthiest Amnian families, who apparently wear simpler clothing, resorting to the other displays of status instead.

North and South Amn have been divided and cut off from one another until recently. With the Trade Way Pass opening, a semblance of normalcy is expected to return, though whether it will remains to be seen...

Subjugated individuals in Amn are known as "Drudges"; bondage of a person, willing or not, in exchange for unpayable debts or crimes against. Indentured Servitude is willingness to be a servant in exchange for some benefit, i.e. earning citizenship or passage to Amn.

Tethyr & Amn are far from lawless countries. The Black Days of Eleint & the recent rule of Queen Zaranda only reaffirmed adherence to well-defined law in Tethyr, while South Amn mold their own after Tethyr, now without overarching authority from Athkatla.

The Interregnum (1347 DR-1369 DR) was a pivotal time in Tethyr when the country was without a ruling body. It began with the death of the royal family. Nearly all of the royal court and the nobility met bloody and horrendous deaths.
Harbour King Degos, situated in the city of Murann, is the ruler of South Amn, though the most influencial of the Swordbelt's nobility supposedly hold considerable sway over the divided nation.

Ever since Athkatla's demise, Murann has become one of the largest bastions of civilisation in Amn and the closest port in the Swordbelt worth its salt. The city is said to have sea winds for hair and salt water for blood.
Muranni brag that the city's Alchemists' Guild is equal to any in Cormyr, Thay, or even “Backwaterdeep”, and it may even be true in the wake of The Longest Year’s toll on most kingdoms and countries.

The Swords of Darromar is a new company led by Lionar Neravel Trosbann of Darromar. It consists of Darromar’s regional mercenaries, some soldiers, and those hired along the way. The small group has grown larger with their mission to support Tethyr and its queen.

The Muranni Alchemists' Guild is the largest of its kind in Amn. Combining alchemists, enchanters, magi, and scientists of all sorts under one roof, the guild hall in Murann is known to be one of the safest places to publicly discuss and practice magic in Amn.

The Starspire Accord is a militant, well-sanctioned force for Good and Law with the backing of many faiths and much of the local nobility. Together, some hundred strong, they provide orderly and morally Good martial support and influence throughout the Swordbelt.

The Black Skull Privateers are a clan of ex-pirates, now sworn to Tethyr & the defense of the coast. They have 7 ships with a captain each, yet all defer to Eamon Blaskul of the Queen's Pardon, who tempers the varying personalities of the other captains.

The Firedrake Lodge is an adventurers' guild known for uncovering rumours of illicit deeds & countering untoward plots. Its respect by the community of the Swordbelt has led to claiming membership of several notable locals and positive acclaim from notable local leaders.

The Servants of Greywell are a long-standing network of information brokers and spies (often perceived as a thieves guild). They are rarely spoken of, even in Murann, as their existence is largely unknown to the most.
Talk of secession from Amn, some discreet, some blatant, circulates in the Swordbelt. According to hearsay Riatavin and Trailstone are at the fore of such considerations.
The churches of Umberlee and Valkur in Murann are currently in an uneasy truce as they both focus their attention towards opposing the Nelanther pirate armada.
Kelemvor, the god of death, is but a new one among the gods, though His worship has already become relatively popular in Murann and some parts of Amn's countryside.

The forest of Karnann - meaning Birchwood in an old Amnian dialect - supposedly once belonged to an ancient elven clan, whose devotion to nature apparently surpassed that of all others. It is said humans drove this clan to extinction centuries ago.
The Goatherd Paths, inhabited by few nowadays, is home to some of the best cheese Amn has to offer. However its harsh terrain proves a challenge to most travellers and pilgrims.
The village of Dorletta in Amn is known for its excellent fish and unique dishes, as well as its warm hospitality. The Angler's Hall is said to rival the best inns of Murann itself.

The Ten Black Days of Eleint was a period of total chaos in Tethyr, from the 12th to the 22nd of Eleint in 1347 DR. Siege warfare, riots, and outright slaughter served as the dark beginning of the Interregnum, a period of twenty years when the kingdom was without a ruler.

The erstwhile village of Tharvathan toward the Ommlur Hills and The Small Teeth was once known for unmatched marblers. It is said by historians that it fell in 1350 DR to a marauding orc warband, though locals ascribe its destruction to dark sorcery.
There are numerous new spells and abilities for all classes on TDN. Be sure to check out the TDN Wiki for all relevant information.

Due to the significant homebrew lore of the server, particularly The Longest Year, one cannot simply recognise a spell at a glance without knowledge and understanding of magic. A successful Spellcraft roll is mandatory for IC recognition.

Warlocks are universally treated as undesirable and are likely to struggle within the setting. The class is considered permanently Opt-In from creation - it isn’t recommended for new players or those that shy from conflict.

You may only rest in designated areas or using purchasable camping supplies outdoors. These set a rest cooldown of 45 and 75 minutes respectively. Outdoor rest cooldowns are reduced by tents and specific character features.
Temporary objects can be created (!invisplc) and edited (!itemedit) to leave descriptions of scenes or actions for other players. Remove these using the same command (!invisplc) on the object.

Magic has been unstable since its return after The Longest Year. Perhaps the most prevalent side-effect has been the apparition of "magical anomalies"; chaotic tears in the stability of the weave that seem to be caused by the use of magic, both arcane and divine.
The laws of Amn and Murann are many and sometimes complex - the wiki details the relevant ones.

As the act of spawning an Animal Companion, Familiar, or 'Summon' is no longer a matter of extraplanar summoning nor summoning of any kind, players are expected to RP their appearance and existence in more mundane ways. Conjuration is the only magical option.

Changes to Conjuration magic are poorly understood following The Longest Year. It is speculated that small pathways to the planes may be mending - but the behaviour of familiars and summoned creatures remains erratic.
Report any bugs (!br <description>). If something is exploitable or serious, open a DM ticket on Discord.
Damaging cantrips have unlimited casts. Casting a spell above 2nd level will cause that spell level to go on cooldown (!cd).
Many feats, skills, races, and spells have been reworked for balance purposes. Review these and the TDN 11 design vision on the wiki.
You can open the player menu with "!menu".

Divine Might and Divine Shield no longer require Power Attack as a prerequisite feat, and are instant cast. Bonuses are limited to your Cleric/Paladin class level (and cannot exceed +2 for Divine Shield).
Knockdown and Improved Knockdown have a shared 11 second cooldown for player characters.
Hide in Plain Sight is usable once a minute with a minimum 10/15 meter distance for urban/natural environments. Every Shadowdancer level reduces this cooldown by 3 seconds.
Expertise and Improved Expertise have been removed as feat options, along with Disarm and Improved Disarm.
Thank you for enjoying The Dragon's Neck!
Most weapons types have been adjusted. This may include damage, critical range, type, size, or proficiency. Refer to the wiki for more details.
Animal Companions, Familiars, and Summons have been overhauled and received in-game commands. Refer to the wiki for more details.
Wizards and Sorcerers casting spells on themselves have their effects automatically duplicated on their familiars.
Intelligence penalties have been removed from race modifiers and various other racial benefits and downsides have been adjusted from the base game. Review the “Races” page on the wiki.

Points of Interest (POI) are Skill-based triggers. They can range from an overgrown landmark detailing the area's history through Knowledge: Religion, to a runic tablet revealing a hidden dungeon via Knowledge: Arcane.

At 0 HP, you are incapacitated and will make recovery rolls to avoid bleeding out. You accrue a grim wound at -10HP (a mortal injury and narrowly avoiding death). Grim wounds heal with time or via temple services, but accruing 3 at once will result in permanent death.
Guard your wealth carefully, as it is dropped if you reach -10 HP. Banks in civilisation offer the most reliable method of avoiding monetary loss.
Skills have been adjusted and new ones added, along with Skillsets. Review the “Skill Changes” page on the wiki for more information.

The Assassin PrC has been overhauled to be mundane, no longer a spellcaster, but instead employing gadgets and tools. Custom poisons exist for their use and the Assassin’s Dagger weapon benefits from Dagger feats.
The Shadowdancer PrC has been overhauled to embrace the theme of a class that operates in the shadows, and maximizes their damage and utility with shadow-based abilities.
Weapon Focus/Specialization/Improved Critical/Weapon of Choice: Feats have been added for new and custom weapons. The Assassin's Dagger uses the Weapon Focus: Dagger feat.
Scribe Scroll and Craft Wand work differently. Brew Potion has been removed. Refer to the “Feat Changes” wiki page for more information.
Other PCs will be shown as a generic identifier. You can set a custom name for them (!n <new name>) visible only to you.

The Noticeboard system is designed to provide players an engaging method of communication that can be seen both in-game and in Discord. The content of notices should be IC and all TDN rules apply to them.
TDN's Persistent Storage functions as a way for players to permanently store their items. Players start with 10 item slots upon opening a bank account, and can purchase additional slots.
Dungeons on TDN are designed to be tackled as a group, and are most rewarding when doing so. Consider forming a party!

Common is the default language. PCs receive a bonus language depending on their race, and additional languages equal to any positive INT modifier (!lang). See “Languages” on the wiki for regional language recommendations.
Restricted languages cannot be chosen at creation but can be learned during play. See “Languages” on the wiki for more information.
Purchase an “Adventurer’s Map” to retain minimap discovery between server resets. Gwardle & Snagswyck's in Murann is one store for these.
Multiclass XP penalties have been removed on TDN.
The maximum enhancement bonus to Ability Scores is +8, including item and spell effects.
The maximum enhancement bonus to Skills is +8, including item and spell effects. Feats and racial abilities bypass this cap.
Tumble no longer provides an AC bonus while using Heavy Armor or a Tower Shield.
Power Attack and Improved Power Attack trade -1/-2AB for +1/+2 damage respectively. Two-handed weapons instead trade -1/-2AB for +2/+4 damage. This is applied separately as bonus damage.
Two Weapon Fighting now requires 13 Dexterity and automatically grants Ambidexterity. If Ambidexterity is received as a class feat, Two Weapon Fighting is also granted.

Some Prestige Classes grant additional spellcasting levels to give actual caster levels, but you still can only learn new spells by taking levels in the original casting class afterwards (or from scrolls if a Wizard).

Type of feat: Class
Prerequisite: Draconic Bloodline Sorcerer (Level 9)

Specifics: Once every hour, the Sorcerer is able to project the same intangible aura of dread as that of a dragon. Enemies in the area must make a DC 10 + ½ Sorcerer level + Charisma modifier Will save or be feared for 2 rounds. Hostile animals are automatically feared for the same duration with no saving throw.

Use: Activated Ability

Type of feat: Class

Specifics: The wizard may attempt to scry the true identity of another character. Upon succeeding on a Concentration skill check, he learns their true name and whether or not they are disguised. The DC of this skill check is 14 + the scried character's level. Should the wizard fail this check, the scried character is alerted that someone has attempted to scry them but not whom. This ability may be used once per day.

Use: Activated.

Type of feat: Class
Specifics: The wizard's evocation spells, and damage cantrips, have a 3% chance of allowing their next evocation spell of 2nd, 3rd, 4th, 5th, or 6th level to be cast without consuming a spell slot.
Use: Automatic

Type of feat: Class

Specifics: This ability is currently being reworked.

Use: Activated

Type of feat: Class
Specifics: The wizard enchants a non-stackable item, which acts as a beacon leading to the creature that possesses it. Secret Eye may only enchant one item at once, and may be dispelled normally. This ability may be used once per day.

Use: Activated

Type of feat: Class
Specifics: When the wizard successfully casts a Charm spell on an enemy, they become dominated instead. This does not affect enemies charmed by Alluring Enchantments.
Use: Activated

Type of feat: Class
Specifics: The wizard's evocation spells have a 10% chance of dealing an additional 1d10 magical damage to enemies in a 5-meter radius around the target.
Use: Automatic

Type of feat: Class
Specifics: The wizard instantly encases himself in stone. He gains DR 30/+3 and 100% damage immunity to fire, cold, and acid damage. However, he suffers a 25% damage vulnerability to sonic damage and cannot move or perform other actions. This ability may be used once per day. Duration is 3 rounds.
Use: Activated

Level 4 - Glyph of Hate: The sorcerer marks an enemy with a glyph. All melee and ranged damage dealt by that enemy is stored in this glyph. If a new enemy is marked with the glyph, all stored damage is lost. This ability may be used at will.

Level 4 - Transfer Hate: The sorcerer may expend all damage within the glyph to deal 50% of the stored damage to an enemy other than the glyphed enemy as negative energy damage. This ability may be used once every 10 minutes.

Level 9 - Gorge on Hate: The sorcerer may expend all damage within the glyph to heal themselves for an amount of hit points equal to 50% of the damage stored. This ability may be used once every 10 minutes and shares a cooldown with Transfer Hate.

Level 15 - Malevolence: The sorcerer may expend all damage within the glyph to deal 100% of the stored damage to all creatures within the targeted area in the form of negative energy damage, and 50% of that damage to the sorcerer. Affected creatures, other than the sorcerer, are paralyzed for 2 rounds unless they succeed on a Will saving throw. The DC for this ability is 10 + ½ class level + CHA modifier. This ability may be used once per hour.

Bloodline Save: +2 vs Fear

Bonus Spells Known:
Blood Frenzy(2)
Fear (4)
Stoneskin (4)
Dismissal (5)

Level 4 - Essence of the Arcane: The sorcerer creates a well of arcane magic at the targeted location. The well fires bolts of pure energy at nearby enemies, as the Magic Missile spell. The caster level for this spell is always 1. This ability may be used once every 8 minutes. Duration is 6 rounds.

Level 9 - Arcane Dominion: The caster level of the well's Magic Missile spell becomes 3.

Level 15 - Arcane Perfection: The caster level of the well's Magic Missile spell becomes 5. Additionally, nearby allies win a 3-meter radius of the well are protected, as the Shield spell while it persists.

Bloodline Save: +1 vs Spells

Bonus Spells Known:
Invisibility (2)
Dispel Magic (3)
Minor Globe Invul (4)
Lesser Mind Blank (5)

Level 4 - Draconic Spirit: The sorcerer blasts forth a wave of energy from their hands, as the Burning Hands spell. This deals 1d6 + ½ class level damage of the damage type associated with the sorcerer's bloodline instead of its regular damage amount and type. This ability may be used once every 3 minutes.
Level 9 - Majestic Presence: The sorcerer projects an aura of draconic dread. Nearby enemies are frightened for 2 rounds, unless they succeed on a Will saving throw. The DC for this saving throw is 10 + ½ class level + CHA modifier. Animal enemies are not allowed a saving throw against this effect. This ability may be used once every 30 minutes.

Level 15 - Draconic Insight: The sorcerer gains the effect of the See Invisibility spell, and gains immunity to sleep effects, paralysis, and the element associated with their bloodline. This ability may be used once every hour. Duration is 2 rounds + 1 round / CHA modifier.

Draconic-Bloodline Types:?
Black, Green, Copper: Acid
Blue, Bronze: Electric
Red, Brass, Gold: Fire
White, Silver: Cold

Bloodline Save: +3 vs Draconic Element

Bonus Spells Known:
Resist Elements (2)
Gust of Wind (3)
Fear (4)
Elemental Shield (4)

Level 4 - Wild Empathy: This ability functions as the Animal Empathy skill, except that the roll is 1d20 + ½ class level + CHA modifier instead of a skill check.

Level 9 - Allure of the Nymph: The sorcerer adopts the allure of a nymph. Up to two humanoid creatures in a targeted area are dominated unless they succeed on a Will saving throw. The DC for this saving throw is 10 + ½ Sorcerer level + CHA modifier. This ability may be used once every 30 minutes. Duration is 3 rounds.

Level 15 - Fey Camouflage: Instantly disappear, as the Invisibility spell. This ability may only be used in natural and outdoor areas, and may be used once every hour.

Bloodline Save: +2 vs Mind Affecting

Bonus Spells Known:
Entangle (1)
Tasha's Hideous Laughter (2)
Poison (3)
Charm Monster (4)

Level 4 - Lingering Flame: The sorcerer immolates a foe with blazing fire, dealing 1d4 + ¼ class level fire damage to them each round unless they succeed on a Reflex saving throw. The DC of this saving throw is 10 + ½ class level + CHA modifier. If an enemy under this effect dies, it jumps to another nearby enemy within a 3-meter radius. This ability may be used once every 5 minutes. Duration is 5 rounds.

Level 9 - Black Pact: The sorcerer forms a wicked pact with an ally, granting them a +2 bonus to strength and dexterity, and sets their weapon on fire, as the Flame Weapon spell. However, they also suffer 50% vulnerability to cold and a penalty of -4 to savings throws against mind-affecting spells. This ability may be used once every hour. Duration is 10 rounds + ½ class level + CHA modifier.

Level 15 - Hellfire: The sorcerer calls down a pillar of flame, blasting all enemies within the targeted area for 1d6 + ½ class level fire damage, with a successful Reflex saving throw halving the damage. The DC for this saving throw is 10 + ½ class level + CHA modifier. Affected enemies become frightened for 1 round unless they succeed on a Will saving throw. The DC for this saving throw is 1- + ½ class level + CHA modifier This ability may be used once every 30 minutes.

Bloodline Save: +2 vs Poison

Bonus Spells Known:
Scorching Ray (2)
Displacement (3)
Wall of Fire (4)
Dominate Person (5)

Type of feat: Class
Prerequisite: Abyssal Sorcerer 3

Specifics: Abyssal Sorcerers may target an enemy to afflict them with a Glyph of Hate. During this time, all melee and ranged damage dealt by the target will be stored in the glyph and can be used by the Sorcerer, up to a maximum of 8 damage per 3 caster levels. This ability can be used at will.

Use: Activated

Type of feat: Class
Prerequisite: Abyssal Sorcerer 3

Specifics: The Sorcerer can redirect 50% of the damage dealt by the target to another creature in the form of Negative damage. (The target of Transfer Hate cannot be the creature that held the Glyph of Hate. If Glyph of Hate is cast on a new creature, all previous stored damage is lost.The use of Transfer Hate exhausts 100% of the amount stored by Requisition Spite and it must be cast again. Transfer Hate can be used once every 10 minutes.

Use: Activated

Type of feat: Class
Prerequisite: Abyssal Sorcerer 9

Specifics: The Abyssal Sorcerer can feed off of the damage dealt by a target afflicted with Glyph of Hate, healing themselves for 50% of the damage stored by it but expending 100% of the damage stored. Gorge on Hate can be used once every 10 minutes, sharing a cooldown with Transfer Hate.

Use: Activated

Type of feat: Class
Prerequisite: Abyssal Sorcerer 15

Specifics: Once per hour, Abyssal Sorcerers may cause the Glyph of Hate to explode at a target location. This inflicts 100% of the damage stored upon all targets within 3 meters of the location targeted (allies included). All possible targets must make a fear save or be paralyzed with fear for 2 rounds. The Sorcerer takes 50% of total hit points in Negative damage due to the uncontrollable nature of the ability.

Use: Activated

Type of feat: Class
Prerequisite: Arcane Sorcerer 3

Specifics: The Sorcerer creates a well of arcane magic at the targeted location. The Essence will randomly target nearby enemies and cast a Standard Magic Missile(caster level 1) at nearby enemies. The Essence remains for 6 Rounds. This ability is useable once every 3 minutes.

Starting at level 8, The Essence becomes more powerful, now casting Magic Missiles at caster level 3.

Starting at level 15, The Essence of Arcane becomes more powerful, now casting Magic Missiles at caster level 5. Additionally, allies within 3 meters of the Essence will be granted the benefits of the shield spell for 6 Rounds.

Use: Activated

Type of feat: Class
Prerequisite: Draconic Sorcerer 3

Specifics: Draconic Spirit: 1d6 + (0.5/Sorc Level) in Dragon Type Damage as an AoE Similar to Burning Hands. Enemies must make a Reflex Save to take half damage.

Use: Activated

Ability: Charisma
Requires Training: No.
Classes: All.

The higher the character's skill the better the price received when selling or purchasing goods.

Check: The character makes an opposed roll against the merchant's Barter skill. If the merchant wins, the characters pay more for the goods in the store. If the character wins, they pay less. The first time the player interacts with a merchant dictates the prices in that store until their Barter skill improves.
Use: Automatic in stores.
While dual wielding, you are granted a +2 shield bonus to AC.

Type of feat: Class
Prerequisite: Bladesinger 1

Specifics: When wielding a longsword or rapier in one hand (and nothing in the other), the Bladesinger gains a dodge bonus to AC, a bonus to attacks and damage equal to their intelligence modifier. If the Bladesinger is wearing medium or heavy armor, this bonus is lost. This Bonus cannot be higher than the Bladesinger level. In addition Bladesingers have a 20% reduction in spell failure when wearing light armor, and a +5 to Concentration.

Use: Automatic

Type of feat: Class
Prerequisite: Bladesinger 2

Specifics: A bladesinger's style of attack appears like that of a dance of death, the rhythm combat and the sound of blades striking flesh. This whirl of steel and body can be mesmerizing and overwhelming to those that face a bladesinger. While performing a spellsong, the bladesinger gains 20% concealment, freedom of movement and a 20% increase in move speed. A spellsong lasts for a number of rounds equal to their perform skill. A spellsong can be performed once every hour.

Use: Activated

Type of feat: Class
Prerequisite: Bladesinger 4

Specifics: A bladesinger's style of attack appears like that of a dance of death, the rhythm combat and the sound of blades striking flesh. This whirl of steel and body can be mesmerizing and overwhelming to those that face a bladesinger. While performing a spellsong, the bladesinger gains 20% concealment, freedom of movement and a 20% increase in move speed. A spellsong lasts for a number of rounds equal to their perform skill. A spellsong can be performed once every hour.

In addition to the benefits of lesser spellsong, while performing a spellsong all enemies within a short range must make a will save or be confused for 1 round. The DC of this save is 10 + ½ the bladesinger's HD + the bladesinger's intelligence modifier). This is an aura that lasts for the duration of the spellsong.

Use: Activated

Type of feat: Class
Prerequisite: Bladesinger 3

Specifics: At 3rd Level, Once per day when activated, the Bladesinger gains all three of the Automatic Quicken spell feats for 8 seconds. Instant Activated. At 5th level this ability can be used twice per day.

Use: Activated

Type of feat: Class
Prerequisite: Bladesinger 5

Specifics: The Bladesinger gains the same benefits of the divine power and haste for 3 rounds. Usable three times per day. Instant Cast. This spell is not divine in any way.

Use: Activated

School: Conjuration (Teleportation) 
Level: Brd 4, Sor/Wiz 4, Travel 5 
Casting Time: 1 standard action 
Range: Long
Target: Self 
Duration: Instantaneous 
Saving Throw: None 
Spell Resistance: No 

You instantly transfer yourself from your current location to any other spot within range. You always arrive at exactly the spot desired - whether by simply visualizing the area or by stating direction.

Drug: Kammarth 

Illegal if found by authorities in Amn & Tethyr.

Side Effects:
Heightened speed for a short period of time. ((1 Turn))
Loss of function in limbs for a short period of time. ((2 Rounds))

Drug: Heart Burst

Highly illegal if found by authorities in Amn & Tethyr. This is a more notorious version of the Drug "Kammarth".

Side Effects:
Heightened sense of awareness, speed, and overall quickness for a period of time. ((8 Rounds))
Extreme Slugishness and susceptibility to attacks for a period of time. ((8 Rounds))

Drug: Fury Drops

Highly illegal if found by authorities in Amn & Tethyr & The Heartlands.

Side Effects:
Increased Strength & Ability to absorb impacts. Can more easily avoid enemy attacks. ((1 Turn))
Loss of Strength, Constitution and suffers from a slugishness that results in a higher chance of being struck by enemies. ((1 Turn))

However, they also suffer 50% Cold vulnerability and a -4 Save vs Mind Affecting spells. This effect lasts 10 rounds + ½ the Sorcerer’s level + their Charisma modifier. This ability can be used once per hour.

Use: Activated

Type of feat: Class
Prerequisite: Infernal Sorcerer 15

Specifics: Radius: 6 meters. Three Times Per Day, an Infernal Sorcerer may call down a column of Hellfire, blasting all enemies within the area for 1d6 / 0.5 * Sorcerer Level (A Reflex save will result in half damage). Enemies that fail a Will save will be feared for 2 Round. The Save DC for this ability is 10 + 1/2 the sorcerer level + the sorcerer's charisma modifier.
This ability can be used once every 5 minutes. 

Use: Activated
This is the designated dragon type for the sorcerer's draconic bloodline.

Type of feat: Class
Prerequisite: Abyssal Sorcerer 8

Specifics: Grants a +2 to saves against poison and electricity. This improves to +4 at sorcerer level 14.

Use: Automatic

Type of feat: Class
Prerequisite: Draconic Sorcerer 8

Specifics: Grants a +2 to saves against the chosen dragon element and enchanment. This improves to +4 at sorcerer level 14.

Black: Acid 
Blue: Electric

White: Cold
